thread.title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic stalls on extending Man United deal because of concerns over Champions League prospects
thread.title_full: Zlatan Ibrahimovic stalls on extending Man United deal because of concerns over Champions League prospects

author: David Anderson
title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic stalls on extending Man United deal because of concerns over Champions League prospects
text:
Sport Zlatan Ibrahimovic stalls on extending Man United deal because of concerns over Champions League prospects The Red Devils are in sixth place in the Premier League and the Swede is reluctant to miss out again Share Ibrahimovic is the Premier League's leading goalscorer (Photo: Matthew Peters) Share Get Manchester United FC   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
Zlatan Ibrahimovic is stalling on committing his future to Manchester United next season because of concerns over their Champions League prospects. 
Ibrahimovic is reluctant to go a second season without playing in the world’s most prestigious club competition. 
The Swedish striker is 36 in October and believes next season could be his last at one of Europe’s top clubs before he heads to the MLS. 
Champions League football is hugely important to him and he does not want to miss out on it in what is likely to be his final campaign. Ibrahimovic signed an initial 12-month deal with an option to extend (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
United face a fight to qualify for Europe’s elite competition and despite their 16-match Premier League unbeaten run, they are sixth in the table. 
United do have a second route into the Champions League if they win the Europa League and they breezed past St Etienne this week to reach the last 16, where they will face FC Rostov. 
Ibrahimovic was happy to join United last summer on an initial 12-month deal with the option of a second season because he felt their absence from the Champions League would be temporary. 
But United have failed to qualify in two of their last three campaigns and he is delaying committing his future to Old Trafford while their participation in next season’s competition is in doubt. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
